channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 情報源デイリー・ビースト』紙の組合員25人がバイアウト、組合員の約70％に相当。
item.description:
Natalie Korach / The Wrap:
Sources: 25 unionized staffers at The Daily Beast took buyouts, equivalent to ~70% of the guild, including almost all of the outlet's senior staffers  —  The Daily Beast is gutting its senior editorial team after implementing voluntary buyouts last month, with nearly 70% of unionized staffers leaving the outlet, TheWrap has learned.

item.title: RISJが9万人以上を対象に行った2024年デジタルニュースレポート：TikTokのような6つのプラットフォームは、回答者の10％以上に達し、10年前は2つだった。
item.description:
Nic Newman / Reuters Institute:
RISJ's 2024 Digital News Report with a survey of 90K+ people: six platforms, like TikTok, reach 10%+ of respondents for news use vs. two a decade ago, more  —  This year's report comes at a time when around half the world's population have been going to the polls in national and regional elections …

item.title: 米国、英国、フランスのニュースインフルエンサーを調査：英国では過半数が主流派ジャーナリスト、米国ではYouTubeのニュース利用率がはるかに高い、など（Nic Newman/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Nic Newman / Press Gazette:
A look at news influencers in the US, the UK, and France: a majority are mainstream journalists in the UK, much higher YouTube use for news in the US, and more  —  News influencer trend well-developed in US, but in UK mainstream brands and journalists leave less of a gap.

item.title: かつて英国で最も称賛されたジャーナリストの一人であったワシントン・ポスト紙のウィル・ルイスCEOのプロフィールと、彼が権力を追求するために行った多くの妥協について（Harry Lambert/The Daily Beast紙）
item.description:
Harry Lambert / The Daily Beast:
A profile of Washington Post CEO Will Lewis, once one of UK's most feted journalists, and a look at the many compromises he's made in pursuit of power  —  DON'T STOP ME NOW  —  Lewis, the embattled CEO of the Washington Post, has long sought power and success.

item.title: 元WaPoシニア・マネージング・エディターのキャメロン・バーは現在、ウィル・ルイスCEOとロブ・ウィネット次期編集長をめぐる論争に関する同紙の報道を監督している（David Folkenflik/@davidfolkenflik）
item.description:
David Folkenflik / @davidfolkenflik:
Former WaPo Senior Managing Editor Cameron Barr is now overseeing the paper's coverage of the controversies around CEO Will Lewis and next editor Rob Winnett  —  Update: Former WashPost Senior Managing Editor Cameron Barr is now overseeing the paper's coverage of the controversies besetting publisher Will Lewis and his pick as its next editor, Rob Winnett.

item.title: カンヌライオンズ広告祭が賞のカテゴリーにユーモアを加え、広告における「人間とのつながり」の重要性を強調。
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
The Cannes Lions ad festival adds humor as an award category, highlighting the importance of a “human connection” in ads, as AI struggles to create funny ads  —  New humour category highlights ‘human connection’ in a sector beset by a crisis in creativity

item.title: Tegna社は、過去7年間CEOを務めたDave Lougee氏の後任として、Mike Steib氏を新CEOに指名した。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Tegna names Mike Steib as its new CEO, succeeding Dave Lougee, who has been CEO for the past seven years; Steib is currently the CEO of Artsy  —  He succeeds Dave Lougee, who is retiring after 7 years atop the broadcast company.  —  The local TV station giant TEGNA has a new CEO.

item.title: Naver傘下のオンライン・コミック・プラットフォーム「Webtoon」が、米国IPOで最大3億1500万ドルの資金調達を目指し、1株18～21ドルで株式を公開、最大26億7000万ドルの評価額を目指す（Arasu Kannagi Basil/ロイター）
item.description:
Arasu Kannagi Basil / Reuters:
Naver-owned online comics platform Webtoon aims to raise up to $315M in a US IPO, offering shares for $18 to $21 each and targeting an up to $2.67B valuation  —  Online comics platform Webtoon Entertainment said on Monday it is targeting a valuation of up to $2.67 billion in its initial public offering in the United States.

item.title: NBCUが、黒人が所有し黒人が制作するメディアに特化した集団Group Blackと提携し、Peacockで多文化コンテンツハブE！＋を立ち上げる（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
NBCU partners with Group Black, a collective focused on Black-owned and Black-produced media, to launch multicultural content hub E!+ on Peacock  —  NBCUniversal is tapping an outside company to help it bring a broader array of viewers and advertisers under its media tent.

item.title: TikTokがSymphonyジェネレーティブAI広告スイートを拡張、吹き替え、有料俳優ベースのストックデジタルアバター、特定のクリエイターに似せたカスタムアバターを提供（Jess Weatherbed/The Verge）
item.description:
Jess Weatherbed / The Verge:
TikTok expands its Symphony generative AI ad suite with dubbing, stock Digital Avatars based on paid actors, and custom Avatars resembling specific creators  —  TikTok is introducing some new generative AI tools that aim to help organizations and content creators grow their global audiences …

item.title: YouTubeは、Xの「Community Notes」に似た、ユーザーが動画に文脈を追加できる実験的なクラウドソース・ツール「Notes」を、米国でモバイル向けに英語でテストしている（Aisha Malik/TechCrunch）。
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
YouTube is testing Notes, an experimental crowdsourced tool to let users add context to videos, similar to X's Community Notes, on mobile in the US in English  —  YouTube is introducing a new experimental feature that will allow viewers to add “Notes” to provide more context and information under videos …

item.title: ロイター・インスティチュート：「時々、あるいはしばしば積極的にニュースを避ける」と答えた人の割合が39％に達し、2017年から10ポイント上昇（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
Reuters Institute: the share of people who say they sometimes or often actively avoid the news reached 39%, up 10 percentage points from 2017  —  The proportion of people selectively avoiding the news is now ten percentage points higher than it was seven years ago, reaching a new high of 39% across 20 key markets.

item.title: Mozilla、Meta幹部が2022年に立ち上げたプライバシー重視の広告計測スタートアップAnonymを買収、別事業部として運営へ（Allison Schiff/AdExchanger）
item.description:
Allison Schiff / AdExchanger:
Mozilla acquires Anonym, a privacy-focused ad measurement startup launched by Meta executives in 2022, and will run Anonym as a separate business unit  —  Two years after leaving Meta to launch their own privacy-focused ad measurement startup in 2022, Graham Mudd and Brad Smallwood have sold their company to Mozilla.

item.title: テキサス州の連邦陪審は、パーソナライズ広告ターゲティングに関する2つの特許を侵害したとして、アマゾンにアドテク企業アーモンドネットに約1億2200万ドルの支払いを命じる（Blake Brittain/Reuters）
item.description:
Blake Brittain / Reuters:
A Texas federal jury orders Amazon to pay nearly $122M to adtech company AlmondNet for infringing on two patents related to personalized ad targeting  —  Amazon (AMZN.O) must pay nearly $122 million for violating another company's rights in targeted internet advertising technology, a Texas federal jury said on Friday.

item.title: TNTのNBA放映権を失うことは、WBDにとっては痛手だが、年間20億ドル以上の節約にもなり、他のスポーツ放映権購入に充てることができる（New York Times紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
Losing TNT's NBA broadcast rights would sting for WBD but would also save the company over $2B annually, which could be used to purchase other sports rights  —  The company's TNT channel and the N.B.A. have long been inextricably linked, but that may end after next season.  Plus, Charles Barkley is retiring.
